intro: Navarretia savagei, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and blooms from spring to early summer. Navarretia savagei is often found in the Sierra Nevada and coastal ranges, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
